section.title: Your Xaraya installation
section.para: You have probably already downloaded a version of Xaraya and played around. If you haven't, well: let's give it a try!

Download the base distribution and do an install for a public site. Install all shipped modules and stick to the basic theme (Xaraya_Classic). This will give a nice overview of the possibilities of Xaraya.

section.title: Files and their locations
section.para: You can browse around in the Xaraya directory structure. You will first find some basic directories, but when you look further you can encounter several paths that you wouldn't normally see in a for instance static website.
The Xaraya core is placed in /includes, /var, /xaradodb, /themes and ...

The directory /modules hold all the extensions (modules). Make sure you have articles, categories, dynamicdata and example in there. There are more, but we will mention these in this guide. The module example is the important example module that will serve as a template for our module later on.

section.title: Hooks
section.para: Hooks are one of the nice key features of Xaraya. You will need some time to dive into the subject, but once mastered (and it's not that hard), you will see the enormous power.
Xaraya uses hooks to let parts of the installation talk to other parts. The Site Admin can decide which hooks to allow.
